synopsis.text:
Anime enthusiasts were given a fleeting glimpse of a thrilling racing world in "Shiden," a modern car racing anime targeted at tween and teen audiences. Initially envisioned as a 26-episode series, following in the footsteps of the iconic "Speed Racer," the project faced numerous challenges that ultimately led to its cancellation.

The pilot episode, a 30-minute spectacle, was unveiled at the 2004 Tokyo Anime Fair, generating a buzz among fans. Anime Crash, a co-producer stepping into this role for the first time, had ambitious plans for a simultaneous release in the USA and Japan by the end of 2005. However, financial constraints dashed these hopes, leaving "Shiden" as a promising project that never reached its full potential.

Despite the setbacks, a trailer and the pilot episode were completed and licensed for domestic release by Anime Crash. The project even had a dedicated website, openly accessible to the public. Yet, the anime world was left yearning for more as "Shiden" never progressed beyond its initial stage, leaving fans to wonder about the unrealized adventures that could have been.
